links.title: Simpsons Dot-Com Era
links.description: This is a funny depiction of the early 2000(s) when dot-com companies survived off of VC funding with nothing more than the potential and hope of making a profit. Companies lured employees with casual work environments, low salaries but the promise of huge stock shares/options hoping that they would eventually become profitable and go public or be acquired/bailed out.

links.title: 4 Stocks That Belong in the Trillion Dollar Club
links.description: The trillion dollar club is starting to get crowded. Okay, not that crowded, but it does look like the trillion dollar club is about to welcome its second member. links.title: What We're Watching At The Citi Tech Conference
links.description: The Citi Global Technology Conference this Wednesday and Thursday is timely. We're two months into the third quarter. Third quarters are important in tech because you have the build for the holiday season. Investors will be looking for any hints from management how trends are progressing. Here's some of the things we're looking for...

messages.body: What Warren Buffett Is Buying These Days $AAPL Also $KO $WFC https://goo.gl/9xBnHX

links.title: What Warren Buffett Is Buying These Days
links.description: "I don't know when to buy stocks, but I know whether to buy stocks," said investor Warren Buffett on a CNBC interview. Buffett recently celebrated his 88th birthday and promoted the idea that even though the stock market is at record highs today most investors are still better off owning a basket of diversified equities than long-term bonds.

links.title: The evidence is mounting that Apple's next big product will be a pair of computer glasses (AAPL)
links.description: Apple said earlier this week that it bought a small Colorado company that worked on lenses for augmented reality glasses. It's pretty clear at this point that Apple is working on a pair of its own smartglasses.
